page.title: 01Review of our Block.
page.content: Our block is in the South of the county of Gloucestershire. The nearest large cities and towns are; Bristol to the South,Stroud,Cheltenham and Gloucester to the North. The area is predominantly rural,being situated in the Cotswold Hills,and is an area of outstanding natural beauty.Spectacular views of the Severn Estuary can be seen on clear days. There are no large settlements in the block,the biggest being the village of Uley,which has a population of about 1,500. Industry in the block is mainly agricultural,although there are a few cottage industries. The area has one primary school in the village of Uley, which has 96 children on roll at present.The area is steeped in history,with Iron Age and Roman remains centred mainly round the village of Uley.
